references.paper_title: GPT-4 technical report
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of large language models (LLMs), which are central to the proposed GenIR pipeline for generating a large-scale image restoration dataset, showcasing the advancement of the NLP field and enabling significant progress in AI-generated content (AIGC).

references.paper_title: NTIRE 2017 challenge on single image super-resolution: Dataset and study
references.reason: This paper presents a foundational dataset and study for single image super-resolution (SR), a core task within image restoration, providing valuable benchmarks and laying the groundwork for improvements in the field.

references.paper_title: Lora-IR: Taming low-rank experts for efficient all-in-one image restoration
references.reason: This work contributes to the advancement of all-in-one image restoration, closely related to the goals of DreamClear. The efficiency of its approach aligns with the importance of high-capacity models as discussed in the introduction.

references.paper_title: Toward real-world single image super-resolution: A new benchmark and a new model
references.reason: This paper addresses the critical challenge of generalizing image super-resolution models to real-world scenarios, which directly relates to the goals of DreamClear and highlights the limitations of existing datasets.

references.paper_title: Deep equilibrium diffusion restoration with parallel sampling
references.reason: This paper showcases the latest advancements in diffusion-based models applied to image restoration, serving as a strong baseline for comparison with the DreamClear model and establishing its state-of-the-art performance.

references.paper_title: ImageNet: A large-scale hierarchical image database
references.reason: ImageNet is a crucial large-scale image dataset that has profoundly impacted computer vision, including image restoration. Its success highlights the importance of large, comprehensive datasets, directly addressing the shortcomings of current IR datasets.

references.paper_title: Is synthetic data from generative models ready for image recognition?
references.reason: This work highlights the potential and limitations of synthetic data in image recognition, closely tied to the GenIR pipeline which relies on synthesized datasets for image restoration model training. This study is essential for evaluating the quality and applicability of synthesized datasets for image restoration.

references.paper_title: PixArt-a: Fast training of diffusion transformer for photorealistic text-to-image synthesis
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it is the foundational model used for the DreamClear architecture. The efficiency and photorealistic capabilities of PixArt-a are crucial for enabling the high-capacity restoration provided by DreamClear.

references.paper_title: SwinIR: Image restoration using Swin Transformer
references.reason: This work provides a state-of-the-art image restoration model that is utilized as a component in DreamClear and offers a strong baseline for comparison. The performance of SwinIR in DreamClear is crucial, highlighting the significance of this selection.

references.paper_title: DreamPose: Fashion image-to-video synthesis via Stable Diffusion
references.reason: This paper significantly contributes to the understanding of Diffusion-based models used in image generation and synthesis, which directly relates to the methodologies and technical foundation behind the DreamClear model. The advanced capabilities of Stable Diffusion models underscore the importance of this paper.

references.paper_title: Denoising diffusion restoration models
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel approach to image restoration utilizing denoising diffusion models. This is highly relevant because it is a key technique used in DreamClear for the development of a high-capacity real-world image restoration model.

references.paper_title: LSDIR: A large scale dataset for image restoration
references.reason: This paper introduces a large-scale dataset specifically designed for image restoration, directly addressing the scarcity of high-quality datasets for real-world image restoration applications, a central challenge that GenIR and DreamClear aim to address.

references.paper_title: Mask R-CNN
references.reason: This work presents a state-of-the-art object detection model. Its influence is critical in evaluating downstream vision tasks after image restoration, demonstrating the benefits of the DreamClear model in enhancing the performance of other computer vision applications. This reference indicates how the developed model is impacting the field.

references.paper_title: Adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This work is crucial for understanding the ControlNet architecture used in DreamClear.  ControlNet is a key component that allows for fine-grained control of the image generation process, enabling the incorporation of various restoration experts in DreamClear and improving its overall performance.

references.paper_title: SeeSR: Towards semantics-aware real-world image super-resolution
references.reason: This paper presents SeeSR, a state-of-the-art image super-resolution model for real-world scenarios, which DreamClear directly benchmarks against. It provides a relevant comparison point that validates the superior performance of DreamClear, demonstrating its efficacy and innovation.

references.paper_title: Designing a practical degradation model for deep blind image super-resolution
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it focuses on the critical problem of creating realistic degradation models for image restoration, directly addressing one of the key challenges that GenIR and DreamClear aim to overcome.  This work directly influences how image degradation is handled in the experiments.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational technology of Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs) that underpins both DreamClear and many state-of-the-art image restoration methods. Understanding LDMs and their applications in image generation and restoration is crucial for assessing the innovation and performance of DreamClear.

references.paper_title: SDXL: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces the advanced SDXL model, which is foundational to the GenIR pipeline for generating datasets and is directly used in the training of the DreamClear model, indicating that the performance of DreamClear significantly relies on this model.

references.paper_title: SeeSR: Towards semantics-aware real-world image super-resolution
references.reason: This paper serves as a direct benchmark for DreamClear in real-world scenarios, enabling a quantitative comparison of its performance against other state-of-the-art methods.  The work demonstrates the performance of DreamClear against a strong baseline.

references.paper_title: Deep equilibrium diffusion restoration with parallel sampling
references.reason: This paper provides a strong baseline for comparison with the DreamClear model, particularly relevant due to its use of parallel sampling and deep equilibrium diffusion.  The techniques and innovations from this work are contextual to understanding the context of DreamClear's advancement.
